Class DisjointSets

java.lang.Object
  DisjointSets
public class DisjointSets
extends java.lang.Object

Disjoint set class, using union by rank and path compression. Elements in the set are numbered starting at 0. EDIT - Modified by Ben Boyter to add some more functionality

Constructor Summary

          Construct the disjoint sets object.

Method Detail

getSet

public int[] getSet()

union

public void union(int root1,
                  int root2)
Union two disjoint sets using the height heuristic. root1 and root2 are distinct and represent set names.

Parameters:
root1 - the root of set 1.
root2 - the root of set 2.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if root1 or root2 are not distinct roots.

find

public int find(int x)
Perform a find with path compression.

Parameters:
x - the element being searched for.
Returns:
the set containing x.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x is not valid.

sameSet

public boolean sameSet(int x,
                       int y)
Preform a check to see if 2 elements are in the same set. Added by Ben Boyter.

Parameters:
x - The first element
y - The second element
Returns:
true if they are in the same set, otherwise false

allSameSet

public boolean allSameSet()
Preforms a check to see if all elements are in the same set. Added by Ben Boyter.

Returns:
true if al in the same set, otherwise false.
